author: Sarah Tate
title: Georgia Eatery Serves The Best 'Cheap' Steak In The Entire State | 97.9 WIBB
text:
When you think of a delicious, juicy steak dinner, you may imagine a fancy steakhouse with sky-high prices to match — but that's not always the case. Fortunately for those who may be on a budget, you don't have to spend an exorbitant amount of money for incredible steak. Cheapism search around the country for the best cuts of steak that "don't have to break the bank," compiling a list of the best "cheap" steak in every state.
According to the site, the best affordable steak in all of Georgia can be found at Ray's on the River . Though it may seem pricey for a "cheap steak" list, its huge cut of ribeye could keep you fed for a while. This Atlanta-area eatery has a 4.7 star Google rating and over 9,000 reviews, so customers clearly enjoy visiting this fine dining establishment serving elevated seafood dishes and incredible steaks. Ray's on the River is located at 6700 Powers Ferry Road NW in Sandy Springs.
Here's what the site had to say:
"If you're willing to think big, you can net a bargain at Ray's on the River. Their 24-ounce cowboy rib-eye checks in at $70, but it's enough to feed three people. It's the economical way to savor a pricey fine steakhouse for a steal of a deal." To see more of the best cheap steak around the country, check out the full list at blog.cheapism.com .

author: Julio Ernesto Heredia
title: Medios internacionales destacan la tragedia en la discoteca Jet Set de Santo Domingo
text:
Redacción. – La tragedia ocurrida en la madrugada de este martes en la discoteca Jet Set, ubicada en Santo Domingo, ha conmovido no solo a la República Dominicana, sino también al mundo entero. Con al menos124 muertos y más de 150 personas heridas, el colapso del techo de este conocido establecimiento ha sido cubierto ampliamente por medios internacionales, reflejando el impacto de la tragedia y la solidaridad de diversas naciones.
El Universal de México , uno de los periódicos más influyentes de habla hispana, dedicó un extenso artículo en su edición digital para informar sobre los sucesos en Santo Domingo. La publicación destacó los esfuerzos de rescate, así como las expresiones de condolencias provenientes de líderes mundiales, enfatizando la magnitud del dolor que atraviesa la nación dominicana.
El País de Bogotá , importante medio de comunicación colombiano, también dedicó espacio a la tragedia, destacando la respuesta del pueblo dominicano y el trabajo de los rescatistas. El artículo de El País subrayó cómo la sociedad dominicana se ha unido en medio del dolor, resaltando la solidaridad internacional que ha rodeado a la nación en estos momentos tan difíciles.
En Europa, el canal France24 , uno de los principales medios internacionales, también cubrió la tragedia con una cobertura en tiempo real, informando sobre el colapso del techo y el número creciente de víctimas. France24 destacó la rapidez con la que las autoridades y los equipos de rescate llegaron al lugar del desastre, y compartió los mensajes de condolencias enviados por figuras internacionales. La tragedia fue presentada como un fuerte recordatorio de los peligros en edificios antiguos y la importancia de la seguridad pública.
Por su parte, El Periódico , de España, se hizo eco de la noticia con un enfoque en las historias personales de las víctimas y la forma en que la comunidad dominicana se ha unido para enfrentar la tragedia. En su cobertura, el medio resaltó los esfuerzos por encontrar sobrevivientes entre los escombros y el trabajo incansable de los rescatistas, quienes han sido aclamados como héroes nacionales.
Euro Express , otro medio destacado, también ofreció un análisis sobre las implicaciones de este desastre en la seguridad de los lugares de entretenimiento en la región. Su informe incluyó citas de expertos en arquitectura y seguridad estructural que explicaron cómo los colapsos de edificios antiguos pueden ocurrir si no se les da el mantenimiento adecuado.
Además de estos medios, otros periódicos y canales internacionales, como The Guardian , BBC News y CNN , cubrieron la tragedia, brindando actualizaciones continuas sobre el número de víctimas, las investigaciones en curso y el apoyo internacional hacia las familias afectadas.
La cobertura internacional de la tragedia en la discoteca Jet Set refleja la magnitud del dolor compartido por millones de personas en todo el mundo, que se han solidarizado con la República Dominicana en estos momentos tan difíciles. Los medios han destacado, además, el esfuerzo heroico de los rescatistas y el pueblo dominicano, que sigue demostrando resiliencia frente a esta desgarradora tragedia.

author: Pavitra Bhashyam
title: IMD: Coldwave conditions in some districts of Telangana
text:
[Telangana News](https://www.news9live.com/state/telangana)
IMD: Coldwave conditions in some districts of Telangana
Coldwave conditions are very likely to prevail in some pockets in Adilabad, Komarambheem Asifabad, Mancherial, Nirmal districts.
Hyderabad: Misty or hazy conditions is very likely to prevail during morning hours at some places in some districts of Telangana on December 13, 14. Minimum temperatures are likely to be below normal (2.0°C-4°C) in some districts during the next three days, India Meteorological Department said in its forecast.
Coldwave conditions are very likely to prevail in some pockets in Adilabad, Komarambheem Asifabad, Mancherial, Nirmal districts over the next three days with the weather department issuing an orange alert. Yellow alert was issued for Hyderabad, Jagtial, Jangaon, Jayashankar Bhupalpalle, Kamareddy, Karimnagar, Medak, Medchal Malkajgiri. Dry weather is likely to prevail over the state later amid the intensifying winter chill.
In its five-day temperature forecast, the weather department said that Adilabad, Komarambheem Asifabad, Mancherial, Nirmal districts will likely record temperatures between 5-10°C while Hyderabad may see temperatures between 11-15 degrees Celsius.
Adilabad records lowest temperature:
On Thursday, Bela in Adilabad recorded the lowest temperature at 7 degrees Celsius and Hyderabad recorded the lowest temperature of 10.9°C at BHEL factory in Sangareddy.
Maximum and minimum temperatures in Hyderabad are likely to be 30 and 18 degrees Celsius respectively. Surface winds are likely to be northerlies/north-easterlies with wind speeds of 4-8 kmph.
Click for more latest [Telangana news](https://www.news9live.com/state/telangana). Also get top headlines and [latest news](/latest-news) from [India](/india) and around the [world](/world) at News9.

author: Nathan Yasis
title: Francisco Alvarez's Mets extension halted by Bad Bunny legal case
text: Sources indicate that the [New York Mets](/mlb/new-york-mets) were negotiating a long-term extension with their young catching star, Francisco Alvarez, when discussions were abruptly halted due to the decertification of Alvarez’s agency, Rimas, led by [Bad Bunny](/tag/bad-bunny). The agency is embroiled in a legal dispute with the MLB Players Association [over its status as reported](https://nypost.com/2024/07/25/sports/mets-contract-talks-with-francisco-alvarez-hit-roadblock/) by Jon Heyman of the New York Post, but Alvarez has affirmed that Rimas still represents him. It's unclear when or if the contract discussions will resume. Francisco Alvarez and the New York Mets this season On the field, [Alvarez has been a key](https://clutchpoints.com/mets-news-francisco-alvarez-major-rehab-step-new-york-fades) contributor to New York's lineup, hitting .278 with four home runs, 24 RBI, and 44 hits in 158 at-bats this season. The Mets, with a record of 53–48, are 10.5 games behind the NL East-leading Phillies. However, they currently hold the second NL wild-card position, narrowly ahead of the St. Louis Cardinals by half a game. Bad Bunny's Rimas Sports is facing serious issues with the MLB Players Association. The agency, representing Mets’ Francisco Alvarez and Ronny Mauricio among others, had its main agent William Arroyo decertified after an MLBPA investigation revealed complaints about improper benefits given to players, as reported by ESPN. Allegations against Bad Bunny's Rimas Sports On April 10, the union also rejected the certification applications of Rimas co-owners Noah Assad and Jonathan Miranda due to alleged violations of agent regulations. Bad Bunny, together with his manager Noah Assad, established Rimas Sports in April 2023. However, just a week later, the MLBPA received evidence that Rimas employees were giving gifts to players they did not represent, such as VIP tickets to Bad Bunny concerts and suite access to a Phoenix Suns game. Additionally, the union accused the agents of violating regulations by providing or promising money, cars, and gifts to entice players to switch representation. Rimas' counter lawsuit In May, [Bad Bunny and Rimas Sports](https://clutchpoints.com/mlb-news-bad-bunny-agency-slaps-mlbpa-with-eye-opening-lawsuit) countered with a federal lawsuit against the MLB Players Association, alleging discrimination. The 27-page complaint was filed in the United States District Court in Puerto Rico, where Rimas is seeking a temporary restraining order and injunction to counteract the MLBPA's sanctions. The agency argues that the penalties were intended to drive the agency out of business and claims the union overstepped its legal authority under the National Labor Relations Act. Rimas had previously sought a temporary restraining order to lift the penalties imposed on Arroyo, Assad, and Miranda, but an arbitrator rejected their request. The agency filed an appeal of the individual penalties before the May 10 deadline, and the American Arbitration Association will make the decision. The three individuals were barred from reapplying for certification for five years, and the union imposed a $400,000 fine, also prohibiting certified agents from associating with Rimas, the individuals, or any related entities. Rimas Sports primarily represents Puerto Rican players and features longtime MLB catcher Ivan Rodriguez as an ambassador. In addition to Francisco Alvarez and Ronny Mauricio, the agency’s clientele includes Rockies shortstop Ezequiel Tovar, Giants’ Wilmer Flores, Reds’ Santiago Espinal, Orioles’ Livan Soto, and top Dodgers prospect Diego Cartaya.
